sentences: Koer tahtis kaasa tulla, aga peremees ajas ta tagasi.
Alguses p端端das tagasi ajada, hiljem tunnistas 端les.
context: The Estonian verb 'l端kata' has two main meanings: 1) To physically push, drive or send someone/something back. This can be used literally like driving an animal away, or figuratively like repelling an attack. 2) To deny, refuse or argue against something, particularly in the context of rejecting statements or claims. The verb implies opposition or resistance - either physical pushing back against movement or verbal pushing back against ideas.
